009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011import java.util.Locale;
012
013import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * This class represents a line in slope-intercept form: y = k x + d. Instances
018 * are immutable. Not all possible lines in the 2D plane can be represented. A
019 * {@link SlopeInterceptLine} is merely a {@link AlgebraicLine} with a special
020 * constructor and getter methods for k, d. See Sec. 10.1 and Appendix F.1 of
021 * [1] for details.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
025 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
026 * </p>
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2022/11/18
030 */
031public class SlopeInterceptLine extends AlgebraicLine {
032        
033        public SlopeInterceptLine(double k, double d) {
034                super(k, -1, d);
035        }
036        
037        public SlopeInterceptLine(AlgebraicLine al) {
038                super(al.getParameters());
039                if (Arithmetic.isZero(al.B)) {
040                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert vertical line (B=0)");
041                }
042        }
043        
044        public double getK() {
045                return A / -B;  // = k
046        }
047
048        public double getD() {
049                return C / -B;  // = d
050        }
051        
052        /**
053         * Returns the line's y-value for the specified x-position.
054         * @param x position along the x-axis
055         * @return the associated y-value
056         */
057        public double getY(double x) {
058                return (A * x + C) / -B;        // = y = k * x + d
059        }
060        
061        // --------------------------------------------------
062        
063        @Override
064        public String toString() {
065                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <A=%.3f B=%.3f C=%.3f k=%.3f, d=%.3f>",
066                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), A, B, C, getK(), getD());
067        }
068        
069        // --------------------------------------------------
070        
071//      public static void main (String[] args) {
072//              Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(1, 2);
073//              Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(4, 3);
074//              
075//              AlgebraicLine al1 = AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2);
076//              System.out.println("al1 = " + al1);
077//              
078//              SlopeInterceptLine sl = new SlopeInterceptLine(al1);
079//              System.out.println("sl = " + sl);
080//              System.out.println("sl k = " + (sl.A / -sl.B));
081//              System.out.println("sl d = " + (sl.C / -sl.B));
082//              
083//              AlgebraicLine al2 = AlgebraicLine.from(sl);
084//              System.out.println("al2 = " + al2);
085//              
086//              System.out.println("al1 = al2 ? " + al1.equals(al2, 1e-6));
087//      }
088/*
089al1 = AlgebraicLine <a=0.316, b=-0.949, c=1.581>
090sl = SlopeInterceptLine <A=0.316 B=-0.949 C=1.581 k=0.333, d=1.667>
091sl k = 0.33333333333333337
092sl d = 1.6666666666666665
093al2 = AlgebraicLine <a=0.316, b=-0.949, c=1.581>
094al1 = al2 ? true
095*/
096}
